title: [JIT] Variables in for loop need to escape to the outer scope
body_html:
test case failes:

======================================================================
ERROR: test_script_for_in_range_scope (__main__.TestScript)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test/test_jit.py", line 1663, in test_script_for_in_range_scope
    @torch.jit.script
  File "/Users/wanchaol/pytorch/torch/jit/__init__.py", line 371, in script
    graph = _script_graph(fn, _frames_up=_frames_up + 1)
  File "/Users/wanchaol/pytorch/torch/jit/__init__.py", line 367, in _script_graph
    return _jit_script_compile(ast, rcb)
RuntimeError:
undefined value output:
@torch.jit.script
def test_script_for_in_range_scope():
    for i in range(1):
        output = FIXME_zerol()
    for i in range(2):
        output1 = output + 1
                 ~~~~~~ <--- HERE
    return output1

I think we should fix it and let the mutated vars escape to the outer scope as it matches with the python syntax.

body:
test case failes:

```
======================================================================
ERROR: test_script_for_in_range_scope (__main__.TestScript)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test/test_jit.py", line 1663, in test_script_for_in_range_scope
    @torch.jit.script
  File "/Users/wanchaol/pytorch/torch/jit/__init__.py", line 371, in script
    graph = _script_graph(fn, _frames_up=_frames_up + 1)
  File "/Users/wanchaol/pytorch/torch/jit/__init__.py", line 367, in _script_graph
    return _jit_script_compile(ast, rcb)
RuntimeError:
undefined value output:
@torch.jit.script
def test_script_for_in_range_scope():
    for i in range(1):
        output = FIXME_zerol()
    for i in range(2):
        output1 = output + 1
                 ~~~~~~ <--- HERE
    return output1

```

I think we should fix it and let the mutated vars escape to the outer scope as it matches with the python syntax.
